item.title: News Article 52
News Article 52
item.description:
Title: Altcoins In Trouble As Seasoned Analyst Predicts 40% Drop In Prices
URL Source: https://www.newsbtc.com/altcoin/altcoins-in-trouble-40-drop/
Published Time: 2024-05-01T23:00:37Z
Markdown Content: [Altcoins have suffered more in the crypto market](https://www.newsbtc.com/altcoin/these-altcoins-are-set-to-inject-billions-into-the-crypto/) following the Bitcoin price crash, leaving a lot of investors in losses. This is not out of the ordinary as these altcoins are known to have a higher volatility compared to Bitcoin, hence, their price swings can be more pronounced. Given the recent decline, the expectation is that the altcoins will recover. However, one analyst does not agree with that assessment.
Altcoins Headed For 40% Crash -----------------------------
In an analysis [posted](https://x.com/intocryptoverse/status/1785310389976043682) on X (formerly Twitter), seasoned crypto analyst Benjamin Cowen shocked the crypto community with his [expectations for altcoins](https://www.newsbtc.com/altcoin/crypto-altcoins-parabolic-curve/). According to the analysis, the worst is far from over for the altcoin market, as there are still more crashes to come.
Cowen explained that this was analyzed using altcoins versus Bitcoin pairs, and it seems each one looks weak against the apex cryptocurrency. This is due to the expected rate cuts, and historical performance suggests that a decline will follow.
![Image 1](https://servedbyadbutler.com/error/blank.gif)
[![Image 2: a screen shot of a purple and blue background](https://servedbyadbutler.com/getad.img/;libID=4112492)](https://servedbyadbutler.com/redirect.spark?MID=172179&plid=2368655&setID=366606&channelID=0&CID=697925&banID=521829427&PID=0&textadID=0&tc=1&scheduleID=2287437&adSize=728x90&mt=1714606414330692&sw=800&sh=600&spr=1&referrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.newsbtc.com%2Faltcoin%2Faltcoins-in-trouble-40-drop%2F&hc=b1848a9801a825a1638b229c905d5740b5c86973&location=)
The crypto analyst pointed to the 2019 rate cuts and how altcoins had reacted to that development back then. Following the rate cuts, altcoins plunged against Bitcoin, with major players recording up to 40% losses during this time. “Perhaps this time is not different? This would mean ALT/BTC pairs drop another 40% from here over the next few months,” Cowen said.
Cowen expects this to place out regardless of what happens in the market in the meantime. He explains that even if the market does recover in the short term, it does not invalidate the thesis. “Short-term countertrends do not invalidate this view,” he stated.
If this repeats, then it could turn an already harsh market trend even bloodier. The [altcoin market cap](https://www.newsbtc.com/altcoin/altcoins-opportunity-zone-santiment-reveals/) has already fallen below $1 trillion as of the time of writing, but a 40% decline from here could send it as low as $600 billion.
[![Image 3: a gold and black poker chip with the words huge get bonus](https://servedbyadbutler.com/getad.img/;libID=4118444)](https://servedbyadbutler.com/redirect.spark?MID=172179&plid=2374569&setID=452518&channelID=0&CID=873125&banID=521839794&PID=0&textadID=0&tc=1&scheduleID=2293218&adSize=728x90&mt=1714606414381147&sw=800&sh=600&spr=1&referrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.newsbtc.com%2Faltcoin%2Faltcoins-in-trouble-40-drop%2F&hc=c5b71778aa028ab80018646b629aa9f36000d792&location=)
Bitcoin Crash Drags Down Crypto Market --------------------------------------
While the Bitcoin crash has been brutal, the [impact on altcoins](https://www.newsbtc.com/news/are-altcoins-cooling-off-analyst-weighs-in-on-this-cycles-market/) has been much more pronounced. Ethereum has held up nicely with less than a 4% decline during this time, but others such as Stacks (STX), Arweave (AR), Neo (NEO), and Sei (SEI) are down an average of 9% in the last 24 hours.
Meme coins were also not left out of the bloodbath, with market leader [Dogecoin](https://www.newsbtc.com/bitcoin-news/bitcoin-dominance-traders-og-dogecoin-altcoins/) dropping 6% to $0.126 and Pepe (PEPE) plunging 7.74% to $0.0000063. Bonk (BONK) recorded a 5% decline to eliminate some of its gains from last week, and [Shiba Inu](https://www.newsbtc.com/shiba-inu/shiba-inu-surprise-binance-japan-listing-ignites-360-price-spike/) fell 4.18%.
Amid all of this, though, there have been some market winners, with [Optimism (OP)](https://www.newsbtc.com/optimism-2/optimism-soars-by-17-despite-recent-security-revelations/) recording 12% gains. Cosmos (ATOM) followed with a 9.8% increase, and Starknet (STRK) rose 9%, making them the top gainers of the day, according to [data](https://coinmarketcap.com/gainers-losers/) from Coinmarketcap.
[![Image 4: a gold and black poker chip with the words huge get bonus](https://servedbyadbutler.com/getad.img/;libID=4118444)](https://servedbyadbutler.com/redirect.spark?MID=172179&plid=2374570&setID=452519&channelID=0&CID=873125&banID=521839794&PID=0&textadID=0&tc=1&scheduleID=2293220&adSize=728x90&mt=1714606414481410&sw=800&sh=600&spr=1&referrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.newsbtc.com%2Faltcoin%2Faltcoins-in-trouble-40-drop%2F&hc=c9669027e5b9b8185e13decf45e88a235be4fd27&location=)
![Image 5: Altcoins total market cap chart from Tradingview.com (Crypto)](https://www.tradingview.com/x/Q4xMXjzI/)
Altcoin market cap at $952 billion | Source: [Altcoin total market cap from Tradingview.com](http://tradingview.com/)
Featured image from Analytics Insight, chart from Tradingview.com

item.title: News Article 52
item.description:
Title: DeFi’s total value locked falls $10 billion in April
URL Source: https://cryptobriefing.com/defi-tvl-drop-april/
Published Time: 2024-05-01T22:43:30+00:00
Markdown Content: Despite the 7% pullback, Bitcoin, Base, and Blast managed to capture more interest from DeFi users. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The total value locked (TVL) on decentralized applications fell $10 billion in April, [according](https://defillama.com/?liquidstaking=true) to data aggregator DefiLlama. That’s a 7% drop in 30 days, as the decentralized finance (DeFi) ecosystem closed last month with $138.6 billion, including liquid staked amounts.
![Image 1: DeFi’s total value locked falls $10 billion in April](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%201809%20311'%3E%3C/svg%3E)
DeFi’s TVL variation in April. Image: DefiLlama
Considering the 10 largest blockchains by TVL, Avalanche registered the most significant monthly drop, with 31.5% of the funds leaving the chain. Solana also saw a considerable amount of crypto leaving its ecosystem as its TVL slump was almost 30%.
[![Image 2: Sapphire](https://static.cryptobriefing.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/18060845/600x500.jpg)](https://sapphire.cryptobriefing.com/?utm_source=cryptobriefing&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=180324&ap=mreciad&offer=x240415070T0U7V)
Nevertheless, the over $6 billion locked in its applications makes Solana the third-largest blockchain in total value locked. Meanwhile, despite the 14.2% drop, Ethereum still dominates almost 69% of DeFi’s TVL.
Despite the outflow of locked funds seen in the decentralized ecosystem, Base and Bitcoin managed to attract more capital and surpass the $1 billion threshold. The Layer-2 blockchain created by crypto exchange Coinbase presented an 18.4% growth, led by Moonwell, Seamless Protocol, and Tarot applications.
Bitcoin was propelled by new L2 infrastructure, which boosted its TVL by almost 39% in a month. Moreover, the Bitcoin DeFi narrative is hyped by industry players, such as services provider Trust Machines. Mark Hendrickson, a member of Trust Machines’ team, shared with Crypto Briefing that Bitcoin has as many functionalities as other blockchains, and events such as Stacks’ Nakamoto upgrade will boost the DeFi narrative.
Blast, another layer-2 blockchain built on Ethereum, showed a slight growth of 4.4% in April and closed the group of winners for the past 30 days.

Dogecoin Jumps After Elon Musk Replaces Twitter Bird With Shiba Inu

Chainlink Investors Could Make a Move Soon ------------------------------------------

Network growth is calculated based on the rate at which new addresses are formed on the network. This data determines whether or not a project is losing traction in the market.

Title: Dogecoin Enters Major Accumulation Zone, Is It Time To Get Back In? | Bitcoinist.com
URL Source: https://bitcoinist.com/dogecoin-accumulation-zone/
Published Time: 2024-05-01T19:30:35-05:00
Markdown Content: [![Image 1: the bit starz logo on a black background](https://servedbyadbutler.com/getad.img/;libID=3854099)](https://servedbyadbutler.com/redirect.spark?MID=172179&plid=2104699&setID=579129&channelID=0&CID=770131&banID=521076925&PID=0&textadID=0&tc=1&scheduleID=2029545&adSize=150x45&mt=1714613671589022&sw=800&sh=600&spr=1&referrer=https%3A%2F%2Fbitcoinist.com%2Fdogecoin-accumulation-zone%2F&hc=67d72ecfa0ac555ac7f2c023a703f13a36b59423&location=)
The foremost meme coin, [Dogecoin (DOGE)](https://bitcoinist.com/dogecoin-sell-off-10-billion-doge/), has entered a major accumulation zone, suggesting that this may be the right time to invest in the crypto token. This is also supported by the fact that the meme coin could soon experience a [trend reversal](https://bitcoinist.com/dogecoin-major-support-doge/) from the current downtrend that it is experiencing.
Dogecoin Market Value to Realized Value (MVRV) Ratio Is A Buy Signal --------------------------------------------------------------------
[Data](https://app.santiment.net/charts?settings=%7B%22slug%22%3A%22dogecoin%22%2C%22ticker%22%3A%22DOGE%22%2C%22from%22%3A%222023-11-01T22%3A59%3A59.999Z%22%2C%22to%22%3A%222024-05-01T22%3A59%3A59.999Z%22%7D&widgets=%5B%7B%22widget%22%3A%22ChartWidget%22%2C%22wm%22%3A%5B%22price_usd%22%5D%2C%22whm%22%3A%5B%5D%2C%22wax%22%3A%5B0%5D%2C%22wpax%22%3A%5B%5D%2C%22wc%22%3A%5B%22%2326C953%22%5D%7D%2C%7B%22widget%22%3A%22ChartWidget%22%2C%22wm%22%3A%5B%22mvrv_usd%22%5D%2C%22whm%22%3A%5B%5D%2C%22wax%22%3A%5B0%5D%2C%22wpax%22%3A%5B%5D%2C%22wc%22%3A%5B%22%23FFAD4D%22%5D%7D%5D) from the [market intelligence platform Santiment](https://bitcoinist.com/why-these-2-altcoins-could-witness-price-bumps/) shows that Dogecoin’s 30-day MVRV ratio is around -15%, meaning many Dogecoin holders are currently at a loss. This negative MVRV ratio also signals a bottom for the meme coin, which usually ushers in a period of accumulation since the crypto token is currently undervalued.
[![Image 2: a banner with the words'bitstarz' and an image of a woman in a red dress](https://servedbyadbutler.com/getad.img/;libID=844202)](https://servedbyadbutler.com/redirect.spark?MID=172179&plid=1983102&setID=367529&channelID=0&CID=727083&banID=520891527&PID=0&textadID=0&tc=1&scheduleID=1911064&adSize=728x90&mt=1714613671589715&sw=800&sh=600&spr=1&referrer=https%3A%2F%2Fbitcoinist.com%2Fdogecoin-accumulation-zone%2F&hc=6417741d72d428d0ad69c7047b48a2f727b3cd1d&location=)
Related Reading: [Cardano Roars Back To Life As ADA Whales Move $13.84 Billion](https://bitcoinist.com/cardano-ada-whales-13-84-billion/)
Besides new investors, Dogecoin’s current holders are also expected to use this opportunity to [accumulate](https://bitcoinist.com/dogecoin-shiba-inu-meme-coins/) more of the meme coin in a bid to break even in their positions. This already looks to be happening, as [data](https://app.intotheblock.com/coin/DOGE/quick-view) from IntoTheBlock shows a notable increase in the token supply held by long-term holders (more than a year).
Crypto investors buying up the Dogecoin dip can add significant buying pressure to the crypto token, which could spark a price recovery amidst this market downtrend. Moreover, on-chain data shows that [Dogecoin whales](https://bitcoinist.com/elon-musk-buying-dogecoin/) are also accumulating during this period. Specifically, 150,000,000 DOGE were [transferred](https://whale-alert.io/transaction/dogecoin/0c9144521d83aa293a208a424b6bea96841cbac2b8697bbae55812109fb73154) from the [crypto trading platform Robinhood](https://bitcoinist.com/robinhood-shiba-inu-shib/) to an unknown wallet, while another 76,316,694 DOGE were [transferred](https://whale-alert.io/transaction/dogecoin/73cf55305afeb2d3861d931acdcc3fc6ee4b8a0f7e353327cc980432b1e5917e) from Robinhood to that wallet.
[![Image 3: a screen shot of a purple and blue background](https://servedbyadbutler.com/getad.img/;libID=4112488)](https://servedbyadbutler.com/redirect.spark?MID=172179&plid=2368621&setID=476001&channelID=0&CID=697928&banID=521829420&PID=0&textadID=0&tc=1&scheduleID=2287403&adSize=728x90&mt=1714613671589420&sw=800&sh=600&spr=1&referrer=https%3A%2F%2Fbitcoinist.com%2Fdogecoin-accumulation-zone%2F&hc=1beba0b0c673581fe1fb4fd6225416a4eaf4bb09&location=)
These whales have a massive influence on the market, and their buys could positively impact DOGE’s price. Meanwhile, it is also worth noting that this price recovery looks imminent for DOGE, considering that recovery has historically always occurred around this MVRV range.
What DOGE Chart Is Saying -------------------------
[Crypto analyst Kevin (formerly OG Yomi)](https://bitcoinist.com/crypto-analyst-says-dogecoin-could-rally-2500-presents-possible-targets/) recently [stated](https://x.com/Kev_Capital_TA/status/1785437140773695576) that Dogecoin is currently at a “major support zone, one which he believes that the meme coin shouldn’t lose if the crypto market is indeed in a “real bull market.” The analyst mentioned in an earlier X (formerly Twitter) [post](https://x.com/Kev_Capital_TA/status/1784731797529534466) that Dogecoin needs to hold above this level to remain bullish.
[![Image 4: a screen shot of a purple and blue background](https://servedbyadbutler.com/getad.img/;libID=4112488)](https://servedbyadbutler.com/redirect.spark?MID=172179&plid=2368622&setID=476002&channelID=0&CID=697928&banID=521829420&PID=0&textadID=0&tc=1&scheduleID=2287404&adSize=728x90&mt=1714613671775222&sw=800&sh=600&spr=1&referrer=https%3A%2F%2Fbitcoinist.com%2Fdogecoin-accumulation-zone%2F&hc=58d1e64954828a912f885d050c71967480dea6c8&location=)
![Image 5: Dogecoin](https://bitcoinist.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/Dogecoin.png?w=512&resize=512%2C308)
Source: X
However, [Dogecoin](https://bitcoinist.com/can-dogecoin-reach-0-2/) risks dropping below that level, especially with the current market-wide downtrend with Bitcoin leading the charge. Moreover, [Fed Chair Jerome Powell](https://bitcoinist.com/bitcoin-takes-a-hit-as-fed-puts-rate-cuts-on-hold/) is set to announce the rate decision on May 1, which could cause DOGE and other crypto tokens to decline further if they decide to take a [hawkish stance](https://bitcoinist.com/crypto-fomc-meeting-most-important-in-years/) and increase interest rates.
Related Reading: [Shiba Inu Sees 144% Spike In Major Metric, But Why Is Price Down?](https://bitcoinist.com/shiba-inu-144-spike-metric/)
At the time of writing, Dogecoin is trading at around $0.123, down over 10% in the last 24 hours, according to [data](https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/dogecoin/) from CoinMarketCap.
![Image 6: Dogecoin price chart from Tradingview.com](https://www.tradingview.com/x/AvwnY9hV/)
DOGE price falls to $0.123 | Source: [DOGEUSDT on Tradingview.com](http://tradingview.com/)
Featured image from LinkedIn, chart from Tradingview.com

For updates and exclusive offers enter your email.
![Image 7: Scott Matherson](https://bitcoinist.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/Scott-Matherson.jpeg?resize=300%2C300)
Scott Matherson is a leading crypto writer at Bitcoinist, who possesses a sharp analytical mind and a deep understanding of the digital currency landscape. Scott has earned a reputation for delivering thought-provoking and well-researched articles that resonate with both newcomers and seasoned crypto enthusiasts. Outside of his writing, Scott is passionate about promoting crypto literacy and often works to educate the public on the potential of blockchain.

item.description:
Title: MicroStrategy Is Building ‘Decentralized ID’ on Bitcoin Using Ordinals-Like Inscriptions
URL Source: https://decrypt.co/229087/orange-decentralized-identity-ordinals-inscriptions-microstrategy
Published Time: 2024-05-02T00:25:16
Markdown Content: #### We do the research, you get the alpha!
Get exclusive reports and access to key insights on airdrops, NFTs, and more! Subscribe now to Alpha Reports and up your game!
[Go to Alpha Reports](https://decrypt.co/degen-alley/reports)
During a presentation at the annual [MicroStrategy World](https://www.microstrategy.com/world-2024/bitcoin-for-corporations) conference in Las Vegas, MicroStrategy co-founder and Executive Chairman Michael Saylor unveiled the open-source MicroStrategy Orange Decentralized Identity protocol.
“Michael presented a very compelling case for why we need decentralized identity and did decentralized identifiers,” MicroStrategy executive vice president of engineering Cezary Raczko told the audience. “He made an even more compelling case why it makes sense to anchor digital identity into the Bitcoin blockchain, protected by the strength and the security of the Bitcoin network.”
Alongside the announcement, MicroStrategy published an unofficial draft of the MicroStrategy Orange specification to [Github](https://microstrategy.github.io/did-btc-spec/).
While the timing of the news was unexpected, Saylor [previously hinted](https://decrypt.co/140670/microstrategy-looking-at-bitcoin-ordinals-for-app-development-says-michael-saylor) that his company was working in the identity and authentication space. He told _Decrypt_ last year that MicroStrategy was more than aware of Ordinals after the protocol launched in January, and interested in exploring how it could inspire software innovations.
[MicroStrategy Looking at Bitcoin Ordinals for App Development, Says Michael Saylor](https://decrypt.co/140670/microstrategy-looking-at-bitcoin-ordinals-for-app-development-says-michael-saylor) -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
MicroStrategy co-founder and Executive Chairman Michael Saylor said the company isn’t just aware of Ordinals, it’s interested in how the protocol that’s set Bitcoin’s community abuzz could lead to software innovation. In an interview at Bitcoin 2023 in Miami, Saylor exclusively told Decrypt that the software firm is looking at Ordinals and assessing its potential in terms of application development. Often used to create NFT-like assets on top of Bitcoin, Ordinals launched in January, and the pro...
“The whole idea of burning a piece of data on the blockchain opens the door to the possibility that I might burn a digital signature, or I might burn a registration, or I might burn a hash of a document,” Saylor said. “Right now, enterprises have weak security compared to Bitcoin.”
The Bitcoin advocate said that innovations using the world's largest cryptocurrency could introduce an entirely new level of security.
“The platform consists of three fundamental pieces, Raczko said late Wednesday.
“At the heart of it is a service cloud, hosted, that allows you to issue those identifiers to your users in your organization,” he explained. “It also allows you to deploy prepackaged out-of-the-box applications that run on the MicroStrategy Orange platform.”
Raczko said the Orange software development kit will make it easy for coders to take these capabilities and integrate them into their own applications and systems.
Using email as an example, Raczko said Bitcoin-based public and private keys generated using MicroStrategy Orange would be inscribed using the Ordinals protocol.
[MicroStrategy Buys Even More Bitcoin, Pushing Stash to $13.5 Billion](https://decrypt.co/228660/microstrategy-buys-even-more-bitcoin-13-5-billion) ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
MicroStrategy, the largest corporate holder of Bitcoin, is again buying the dip. On Monday, the software firm and “Bitcoin development company” announced its Q1 2024 financial results, and took the opportunity to note that it has purchased even more Bitcoin since the end of March amid a rough few weeks for the crypto markets. MicroStrategy purchased 122 additional Bitcoin for a total of $7.8 million between April 1 and April 26, according to the report. While that’s smaller than many of the comp...
According to the MicroStrategy Orange documentation, the decentralized identity protocol uses a modified approach to [inscriptions](https://microstrategy.github.io/did-btc-spec/#inscriptions) as Ordinals, but stores only data related to decentralized identity (DID), meaning documents can be created and updated with few restrictions on size and content while taking advantage of the segregated witness (SegWit) feature of Bitcoin.
“Once you've established that that email is genuine, you accept the invitation, and at that point, we're going to generate your unique decentralized identifier, and the public and private key pair,” Raczko explained. “We're going to send a decentralized identifier and the public key to the Orange server to be inscribed on the Bitcoin Blockchain, \[and\] from that point onward, you are ready to start sending Orange-signed or emails.” > BREAKING: LASER-EYE MAXIS IN ABSOLUTE SHAMBLES AS THEIR LORD AND SAVIOR [@SAYLOR](https://twitter.com/saylor?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw) ANNOUNCES NEW “PROTOCOL” TO INSCRIBE DIGITAL IDENTITY DOCUMENTS ON THE BITCOIN BLOCKCHAIN > > INSTITUTIONAL-GRADE SPAM HAS ENTERED THE CHAT [pic.twitter.com/EMGsZBcZvw](https://t.co/EMGsZBcZvw) > > — Udi | BIP-420 🐱 (@udiWertheimer) [May 1, 2024](https://twitter.com/udiWertheimer/status/1785801347096367332?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)
“\[The\] opportunity we see and want to pursue is integrating the digital identity based on Bitcoin with this bigger, verifiable credential ecosystem which opens up another large number of very interesting use cases where I can now credential my identity anchored to Bitcoin,” Raczko said. He added that the MicroStrategy Orange decentralized identifier could also be used to verify users on social media applications or authenticate a text message, college degree or medical record. “Present those and then have those verified all in a decentralized way, but with the ultimate identity living and being anchored to the Bitcoin blockchain,” Raczko added—suggesting that Orange could make it possible to display an “orange check” for verified users across platforms. _Edited by [Ryan Ozawa](https://decrypt.co/author/ryanozawa)._

Title: Bitcoin miner Riot Platforms reports record $211M Q1 net income
URL Source: https://cointelegraph.com/news/riot-platforms-q1-results-record-211-million-net-income
Published Time: 2024-05-02T00:22:40.000Z
Markdown Content: Riot’s net income was boosted by a 131% year-on-year increase in Bitcoin’s price despite the cryptocurrency becoming more difficult and expensive to mine.
![Image 1: Bitcoin miner Riot Platforms reports record $211M Q1 net income](https://images.cointelegraph.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=90,width=1434/https://s3.cointelegraph.com/uploads/2024-05/56042ab3-e795-48c6-a5cf-c70b4ef5925f.jpg)
Own this piece of crypto history
[Collect this article as NFT](https://mint.cointelegraph.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcointelegraph.com%2Fnews%2Friot-platforms-q1-results-record-211-million-net-income&utm_source=cointelegraph_com&utm_medium=button&utm_campaign=articles)
Bitcoin ([BTC](https://cointelegraph.com/bitcoin-price)) mining firm Riot Platforms reported a $211.8 million net income for Q1 2024 — a company record and a 1,000% increase from the same time last year — but missed analyst revenue estimates.
Riot’s first quarter [results](https://www.riotplatforms.com/riot-platforms-reports-first-quarter-2024-financial-results-current-operational-and-financial-highlights/) released May 1 show minin revenue spiked 55.4% year-on-year to $74.6 million, primarily driven by a 131% increase in Bitcoin’s price.
The firm's total revenue was $79.3 million, fallin 14% short of [estimates](https://www.zacks.com/stock/news/2266179/riot-platforms-inc-riot-q1-earnings-top-estimates#:~:text=of%20the%20Tape-,Riot%20Platforms%2C%20Inc) by research firm Zacks.
The miner said a rise in net income and mining revenue was partially slowed by lower Bitcoin production and higher mining costs due to an increase in Bitcoin’s network difficulty and hash rate.
![Image 2](https://s3.cointelegraph.com/uploads/2024-05/c2f5afe2-0d6b-403f-b74c-07870e69c27c.png)
_Riot’s unaudited financial statement for Q1 2024. Source: Riot Platforms_
Riot mined 1,364 BTC during Q1, [a 36% decrease](https://cointelegraph.com/news/riot-platforms-bitcoin-mining-production-halving) from 2023’s first quarter. Its average cost to mine 1 BTC was $23,000 — 144% more expensive compared to the same time last year which Riot said was “primarily driven by an increase of 89% in global network hash rate.”
Riot announced a [new facility](https://cointelegraph.com/news/bitcoin-mining-stocks-btc-halving) in Corsicana, Texas last month which CEO Jason Les believes will become the largest dedicated Bitcoin mining facility in the world once fully developed.
**_Related:_** [**_Jack Dorsey’s Block announces development of ‘full Bitcoin mining system’_**](https://cointelegraph.com/news/jack-dorsey-block-bitcoin-mining-system)
The mining firm claimed it was on track to increase its hash rate capacity from 12.4 exahashes per second (EH/s) to 31 EH/s before the end of the year.
It anticipates its hash rate will increase to 41 EH/s when its Corsicana facility fully deploys in 2025 and Riot has a long-term goal to reach 100 EH/s in 2027 or soon after.
![Image 3](https://s3.cointelegraph.com/uploads/2024-05/b8ed01f4-f06c-480b-b2d8-1e19493fdabd.png)
_Change in Riot’s hash rate bi-annually by facility. Source: Riot Platforms_
Riot currently boasts the third largest hash rate among miners trailing only rivals Marathon Digital and Core Scientific at 24.7 EH/s and 16.9 EH/s respectively, [according](https://data.hashrateindex.com/stocks) to Hashrate Index.
Riot’s share price fell 2.87% over May 1 to $9.82, but is up 1.1% in after-hours trading, [according](https://www.google.com/finance/quote/RIOT:NASDAQ) to Google Finance.
Bitcoin miners are adjusting after the blockchain’s mining rewards were cut in [the April 20 halving event](https://cointelegraph.com/news/bitcoin-halving-2024-completion-confirmed) from 6.25 BTC to 3.125 BTC — the latter currently worth around $180,600.
**_Magazine:_** [**_Get Bitcoin or die tryin’: Why hip hop stars love crypto_**](https://cointelegraph.com/magazine/get-bitcoin-or-die-tryin-why-hip-hop-stars-love-crypto/)
Explore more articles like this
Subscribe to our Crypto Biz newsletter

item.description:
Title: 'Bitcoin Jesus' arrest raises concerns: 'The U.S. is coming after crypto!'
URL Source: https://ambcrypto.com/bitcoin-jesus-arrest-raises-concerns-the-u-s-is-coming-after-crypto/
Published Time: 2024-05-02T00:00:00+00:00
Markdown Content: ![Image 1: 'Bitcoin Jesus' arrest raises concerns: 'The U.S. is coming after crypto!'](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%201200%20686'%3E%3C/svg%3E)
* _After Sam Bankman-Fried and Changpeng Zhao, Roger Ver is under the radar of the U.S. government._ * _Diverse reactions within the crypto community highlight industry complexities amid legal actions._
The year 2024 is proving to be a golden age for cryptocurrencies, with the exponential growth of this asset class coinciding with a surge in crypto voters.
Notably, a significant portion of this surge in crypto adoption occurred after the 2020 presidential election. Following Biden’s election, there was an unprecedented wave of retail adoption within the cryptocurrency industry.
However, as the U.S. elections 2024 approaches, an unexpected development has emerged.
The United States Department of Justice has announced charges against Roger Ver, also known as [“Bitcoin Jesus,”](https://ambcrypto.com/bitcoin-jesus-charged-with-tax-fraud-and-arrested-in-spain/) on allegations of tax evasion.
#### **Diverging perspective**
Various execs have weighed in on the matter, speculating that it is an anti-crypto stance within the Biden administration.
Highlighting consecutive arrests by the U.S. government, including Sam Bankman-Fried, Changpeng Zhao, and now Roger Ver, [David Shares](https://twitter.com/DavidShares/status/1785399884205507071), a crypto expert noted,
> “The U.S. is aggressively coming after crypto. Just look at the recent targets. If you think you’re not a target, think again. They will come after all of us at some point. We have to fight!”
Echoing similar sentiments, Jane Adams, a 2024 candidate for the U.S. House of Representatives and a supporter of Bitcoin, said,
[![Image 2: Jane Adams tweet on Roger Ver's arrest](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%201176%20366'%3E%3C/svg%3E)](https://ambcrypto.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/Jane-Adams-tweet-1.webp)
Source: Jane Adams/Twitter
However, some execs believed in the steps taken by the U.S. Voicing his apprehensions against Ver, Bitcoin educator, [Dan Held](https://twitter.com/danheld/status/1785374820617650308) said,
> “Good. He’s been a net negative for Bitcoin.”
Adding to the fray, an X user, @koinosthegoat, claimed,
[![Image 3: @koinosthegoat tweet on Roger Ver's arrest](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%201174%20802'%3E%3C/svg%3E)](https://ambcrypto.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/@koinosthegoat-tweet-1.webp)
Source: @koinosthegoat/Twitter
These contrasting perspectives underscore the complexities and divisions within the crypto space, suggesting potential implications for the upcoming U.S. elections.
#### **What’s more to it?**
As a matter of fact, Ver was arrested in Spain on the 30th of April, following criminal charges in the U.S. for offenses including mail fraud, tax evasion, and filing false tax returns.
The DoJ alleges that Ver avoided taxes totaling $48 million on his Bitcoin and cryptocurrency sales in 2017. According to a [press release](https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/early-bitcoin-investor-charged-tax-fraud) by the DoJ,
[![Image 4: US-DoJ's press release](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%201438%20364'%3E%3C/svg%3E)](https://ambcrypto.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/DoJs-press-release-1.webp)
Source: U.S. Department of Justice
However, despite renouncing his US citizenship in 2014, Ver faces extradition to the United States, prompting criticism from crypto veterans and social media users.
Amidst this criticism, [Kim Dotcom](https://twitter.com/KimDotcom/status/1785515855893450813), a crypto veteran who himself was in the same shoes a few years ago, remarked,
> “This indictment has nothing to do with tax evasion. This is a malicious attempt to vilify Roger and to punish him for exposing and opposing the crimes of the US empire.”
As things unfold, it will be interesting to watch how the upcoming U.S. elections will shape the future of cryptocurrency in the States.

Title: Celestia (TIA) Price Targets $7 as Investors Pull Back
URL Source: https://beincrypto.com/celestia-tia-price-correction-likely/
Published Time: 2024-05-01T23:59:00+00:00
Markdown Content: **Celestia (TIA) is prone to further correction after consistently forming red candlesticks over the past few days. The saving grace is that investors are not too keen on saving the altcoin either.**
The most likely outcome for TIA is a five-month low since it follows the cues set by Bitcoin, which dropped below $60,000.
Celestia Investors Save Their Money -----------------------------------
[Celestia’s price decline](https://beincrypto.com/celestia-tia-price-all-time-high/) resulted from the crypto market noting a bearish couple of days in the previous month. However, the broader impact has been on the traders who have opted to withdraw from the asset for now.
This is noted in the decline in the Open Interest (OI), which in the past month has been reduced by 50%. At the start of March, a total of $233 million worth of [shorts](https://beincrypto.com/learn/how-to-short-bitcoin/) and long contracts were opened in the market. This has since come down to $113 million, less than half of the original OI.
This shows that the investors only focus on profitable actions, which could take a while.
![Image 1: Celestia Price Analysis](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
Celesita Open Interest. Source: [Coinglass](https://www.coinglass.com/)
The reason behind this delay is the correlation that TIA shares with Bitcoin. A high correlation of 0.96 exhibits a tethered price action of both assets, with TIA following BTC’s cues. Currently, the world’s largest cryptocurrency is witnessing a bearish outlook, with Bitcoin’s price trading below $60,000.

Further decline in BTC is anticipated, and the condition of Celestia’s price is also the same. Thus, the altcoin could observe some drawdown in the coming days.

Celestia Correlation with Bitcoin. Source: [TradingView](https://www.tradingview.com/)
TIA Price Prediction: Drop to $7 ---------------------------------
[Celestia’s price is testing the support](https://beincrypto.com/tia-holders-optmistic-price-april/) marked at $9.2, which could fail to hold, resulting in a price correction to the next area of support at $8.3. item.description:
Title: Build on Bitcoin Launches Mainnet With Over 40 Apps
URL Source: https://decrypt.co/229079/build-on-bitcoin-launches-mainnet-with-over-40-apps
Published Time: 2024-05-01T23:54:15
Markdown Content: #### We do the research, you get the alpha!
Get exclusive reports and access to key insights on airdrops, NFTs, and more! Subscribe now to Alpha Reports and up your game!
[Go to Alpha Reports](https://decrypt.co/degen-alley/reports)
The [Build on Bitcoin](https://www.gobob.xyz/) (BOB) project announced the launch of its first phase on Wednesday, enabling decentralized apps—dapps—to interact with the world’s top blockchain.
The BOB mainnet is coming online with $300 million in total value locked (TVL) and over 40 dapps already available, the team [said](https://twitter.com/build_on_bob) on Twitter, declaring “a Bitcoin-driven DeFi summer” with more to come in the next three weeks.
Build on Bitcoin is intended to be a hybrid layer-2 network, an “Ethereum rollup” that merges [Bitcoin’s](https://decrypt.co/resources/what-is-bitcoin-four-minute-instant-guide-explainer) global adoption, liquidity, and proof-of-work security with the decentralized finance (DeFi) features of [Ethereum](https://decrypt.co/resources/what-is-ethereum-quickly-explained-four-minute-guide): smart contracts, wallets, and access to stablecoins.
In March, Bitcoin DeFi developer [Sovryn](https://decrypt.co/221633/bitcoin-defi-app-sovryn-expanding-ethereum-heres-how) used Build on Bitcoin to expand its offerings to the Ethereum ecosystem. BOB is meanwhile collaborating with Threshold’s [tBTC](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/tbtc) and [Wrapped BTC](https://decrypt.co/resources/what-is-wbtc-explained-bitcoin-ethereum-defi) (WBTC).
“We currently work with the two leading BTC bridge providers while working on our bridge infrastructure in parallel,” BOB co-founder Alexei Zamyatin told _Decrypt_. “We built a one-click onramp from Bitcoin to BOB that abstracts bridge complexity and makes moving liquidity from BTC to BOB as easy as moving from ETH to an ETH L2 going live next week.”
Zamyatin said Build on Bitcoin is also looking to provide a one-stop shop for Bitcoin Ordinals and Runes, working with teams that provide bridges for Ordinals, Runes, and [BRC-20 tokens](https://decrypt.co/221254/bitcoin-ordinals-brc-20-token-standard-layer-1-foundation).
![Image 1: BOB Mainnet Launch Announcement](https://img.decrypt.co/insecure/rs:fit:3840:0:0:0/plain/https://cdn.decrypt.co/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/Decrypt-Wallpaper-Format-1600-x-900-px-79.png@webp)
Image: Build on Bitcoin
While [Bitcoin DeFi](https://decrypt.co/resources/what-is-bitcoin-defi-and-how-does-it-work) is the goal, the BOB team acknowledged that the number one blockchain is not ready, making “bootstrapping” on Ethereum necessary.
> Why Bootstrapping? > > Despite the high demand, Bitcoin rollups aren't ready yet. Our approach leverages Ethereum's established infrastructure to: > > • Enhance UX for [#Ordinals](https://twitter.com/hashtag/Ordinals?src=hash&ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw), [#Runes](https://twitter.com/hashtag/Runes?src=hash&ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw), & [#BRC20s](https://twitter.com/hashtag/BRC20s?src=hash&ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw). > • Make BTC deployment into DeFi super easy, for both Bitcoin & Ethereum users. > > — BOB (Mainnet Live) (@build\_on\_bob) [May 1, 2024](https://twitter.com/build_on_bob/status/1785601099195678901?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)
“Connecting to Ethereum follows a pragmatic rollout approach,” the team said. “Bitcoin rollups do not yet work, but demand is high: Bitcoin users need access to stablecoins and DeFi, Ethereum users want to use their BTC and get access to Ordinals, Runes and BRC-20s.”
“It is time to end the cult-like feuds and unite the two largest Web3 ecosystems to spearhead mass adoption together,” BOB declared.
According to Zamyatin, the next phase of BOB’s development will achieve Bitcoin proof of work via “merged mining,” enhancing security without disrupting Bitcoin mining. Merged mining refers to the process of mining two or more blockchains at the same time.
“Previous merged mining instances suffered from slow block times (30sec-1min) due to the limitations of Proof-of-Work,” he said.
Finally, the third planned phase will introduce BitVM, enabling a secure BTC bridge with fraud proofs similar to Ethereum's bridges, BOB explains, ensuring safe BTC deposits enforced by Bitcoin nodes.
“This ensures that users bridging in BTC can be certain that their deposits are safe and security is enforced by all Bitcoin full nodes—as long as there is at least one person online to submit a fraud-proof,” he said, noting Arbitrum on Ethereum.
To draw more users to its platform, Zamyatin pointed to a BOB fusion [program](https://app.gobob.xyz/fusion) that the company is using to boost adoption through dapps that increase the TVL and number of users.
According to the Build on Bob website, the total value locked on the platform is currently over $279 million.
“BOB Fusion Season 1 attracted 300 million in TVL from 33,000 users in 4 weeks,” Zamyatin said. “BOB Season 2 that launched today saw $64 million in on-chain TVL inflow in less than 12 hours.”
“Our mission is to make BTC deployment into DeFi super easy,” Zamyatin said. “Think [Yearn Finance](https://decrypt.co/45708/yearn-finance-manifesto-lays-out-leadership-defi-vision) for Bitcoin, and make Bitcoin assets accessible to Ethereum and EVM users—uniting the two largest web3 power-user ecosystems.”
_Edited by [Ryan Ozawa](https://decrypt.co/author/ryanozawa)._

Title: Argentina Lawmaker Unveils Draft Worldcoin Regulation Bill
URL Source: https://cryptonews.com/news/argentina-lawmaker-unveils-draft-worldcoin-regulation-bill.htm
Published Time: 2024-05-01T23:30:08+00:00
Markdown Content: ![Image 1: Tim Alper](https://cimg.co/authors/4/responsive-images/5f9b00066a0e5___media_library_original_300_300.jpg)
Last updated: May 1, 2024 at 23:30 UTC | 2 min read
[![Image 2: an image of a purple and purple background with the words'distribution of interpretation'](https://cimg.co/other/876/337090/presale-v1-desktop.png)](https://rapi.cryptonews.com/outgoing/876/1/9)
[![Image 3: new presales 2014 with an orange arrow pointing to it](https://cimg.co/other/844/337087/eng-sub-m-1.png)](https://rapi.cryptonews.com/outgoing/844/1/17)
![Image 4: Argentina Lawmaker Unveils Draft Worldcoin Regulation Bill](https://cimg.co/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/01151916/1714576755-1714576515669_processed.jpg)
An Argentinian lawmaker has launched a draft bill that proposes regulating [Worldcoin](https://cryptonews.com/coins/worldcoin/) and its operator in [the Latin American nation](https://cryptonews.com/news/argentina-regulator-we-want-to-work-with-crypto-firms-to-police-industry.htm).
The move comes just days [after Worldcoin announced a planned expansion in Mexico.](https://cryptonews.com/news/worldcoin-operator-announces-mexico-expansion-despite-potential-probe.htm) Some Mexican lawmakers have also called for a probe into operator Tools for Humanity.
Argentina Lawmaker: We Must Protect Consumer Rights ---------------------------------------------------
Per [the official news outlet of the Buenos Aires assembly](https://diputadosbsas.com.ar/legislatura-bonaerense-regular-empresas-escanean-ojos-criptomonedas/), the new bill is the brainchild of Buenos Aires parliament member Carlos Puglelli.
The MP, and others, have claimed it is “unclear” what Worldcoin does with the biometric data it collects using its iris-scanning drives.
Puglelli’s bill proposes “regulating companies that scan people’s irises for the purpose of collecting biometric data.”
The bill’s author noted that Buenos Aires authorities should be allowed to “exercise control over activities carried out by companies like Worldcoin.”
[![Image 5: a black screen with the words cofpoker on it](https://cimg.co/other/907/337300/coinpoker-960x200-cryptonews.png)](https://rapi.cryptonews.com/outgoing/907/1/5)
He also called for more “transparency” about happens to the biometric data that “users deliver to these companies, in this case in exchange for a payment in cryptocurrency.”
Worldcoin has proven a hit in Argentina, where it operates over 50 iris-scanning centers.
Buenos Aires MPs Want Worldcoin Investigation ---------------------------------------------
The crypto project has piqued the interest of more Argentina lawmakers.
In mid-April, Romina Braga, another member of the Buenos Aires assembly, called for an official investigation into Worldcoin.
Braga called on Axel Kicillof, the Governor of the Buenos Aires Province, to commission an investigation. She also voiced several privacy and data-related concerns.
![Image 6: A Worldcoin retina scanner orb.](https://cimg.co/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/01151909/1714576748-51303325070_e6b55ce833_k.jpg)
A Worldcoin retina scanner orb. (Source: Steve Jurvetson \[CC By 2.0\]) This follows a move from the national data protection agency, which announced the launch of an investigation into Worldcoin in January this year. Puglelli’s bill calls for the creation of a “regulatory framework” that regulates biometric data collection and introduces punishments for any “abuse” of this data. He explained: > “It is essential to adapt our legislation to meet the challenges posed by the digital era.” Regulator to Get Involved? -------------------------- The bill, if adopted, would see the Provincial Directorate for the Defense of the Rights of Consumers and Users appointed as the “supervisor” of Worldcoin. The Directorate would be charged with “promoting fair and equitable consumer relations in the digital sphere, as well as trust and IT security.” > UK data watchdog to make enquiries about Worldcoin crypto project [https://t.co/nT2PYkzz5P](https://t.co/nT2PYkzz5P) [pic.twitter.com/VESSVtp0i9](https://t.co/VESSVtp0i9) > > — Reuters UK (@ReutersUK) [July 25, 2023](https://twitter.com/ReutersUK/status/1683780433652097024?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)
The media outlet [Criptonoticias](https://www.criptonoticias.com/regulacion/argentina-ley-worldcoin-criptomonedas-buenosaires-datos-biometrico/) reported that Worldcoin has been operating in Argentina “for more than a year.”
It added that “thousands of citizens have transferred their biometric data to the Cayman Islands-based firm.”
Will Lawmakers Get Their Way? -----------------------------
Both Puglelli and Braga have complained that “it is not clear” exactly “what Worldcoin does with iris-scanned data.”
The lawmaker warned that Worldcoin “has no legal status in Argentina and is acquiring biometric data in a way that puts privacy at stake.”.
It remains to be seen if the lawmakers’ warnings will dampen public enthusiasm.
However, they do not appear to be alone. The Buenos Aires Ministry of Production, Science, and Technological Innovation says it has also investigated Worldcoin’s data protection credentials.
> Portugal orders Sam Altman's Worldcoin to halt data collection [https://t.co/xeqg0VHqPg](https://t.co/xeqg0VHqPg) > > — Dr. Alexander Deicke (@AlexanderDeicke) [April 3, 2024](https://twitter.com/AlexanderDeicke/status/1775366311318880681?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)
Mexican lawmakers have also raised concerns. In Chile, another country with multiple data collection centers, government agents have inspected three Worldcoin-related addresses.
Agents asked the firm to submit “additional information” to “ensure that Worldcoin is complying with national regulations.”
Data-related concerns have disrupted Worldcoin iris-scanning efforts in European nations, including Spain, Germany, and [France](https://cryptonews.com/news/worldcoin-discontinues-its-orb-verification-services-in-india-brazil-and-france.htm).
Government agencies in [East Asian](https://cryptonews.com/news/worldcoin-controversy-benefiting-south-koreas-bithumb-exchange.htm) nations such as [South Korea](https://cryptonews.com/news/south-korea-worldcoin-investigation-data-collection-concerns.htm) and [Hong Kong](https://cryptonews.com/news/worldcoin-crypto-project-hong-kong-probe-privacy-concerns.htm) have also launched Worldcoin-related investigations.
[![Image 7](https://cimg.co/other/872/336967/960x200-eng.gif)](https://rapi.cryptonews.com/outgoing/872/1/12)

item.description:
Title: Coinbase Plans To Offer Stablecoin Pegged To Canadian Dollar
URL Source: https://cryptonews.com/news/canadian-stablecoin-coinbase.htm
Published Time: 2024-05-01T22:51:41+00:00
Markdown Content: ![Image 1: Andrew Throuvalas](https://cimg.co/authors/977/responsive-images/at___media_library_original_300_300.jpeg)
Last updated: May 1, 2024 at 22:51 UTC | 2 min read
[![Image 2: an orange button with a white text on it](https://cimg.co/other/523/335247/banner-eng.png)](https://rapi.cryptonews.com/outgoing/523/1/9)
[![Image 3: don't miss out on the hottest presales right now?](https://cimg.co/other/875/337088/presale-v1-mobile.png)](https://rapi.cryptonews.com/outgoing/875/1/17)
![Image 4: Coinbase Canada Stablecoin](https://cimg.co/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/01215657/1714600616-1714600605953_processed.jpg)
Crypto exchange Coinbase is planning to offer a Canadian dollar stablecoin on its platform shortly after receiving an official license to operate within the country.
[In a Twitter update on Monday](https://twitter.com/CoinbaseAssets/status/1785001092301939089), the company said it had added QCAD (QCAD) to its listing roadmap – a CAD-pegged stablecoin that was “re-launched” by Canadian fintech firm Stablecorp last year.
Canadian Dollar Stablecoin On Coinbase --------------------------------------
Much like other popular stablecoins such as Tether (USDT) and USD Coin (USDC), QCAD maintains its peg with full backing by reserves of equal or greater value to the number of tokens that have been issued.
According to Stablecorp, these tokens are backed by cash and cash equivalents, with monthly [attestation reports](https://c212.net/c/link/?t=0&l=en&o=3835790-1&h=877463978&u=https%3A%2F%2Fstablecorp.ca%2Fqcad-attestation&a=Monthly+attestation+reports) to verify their reserve status. Its latest attestation report in February 2024 said there were just 169,303.77 QCAD in circulation versus $200,903.17 in Stablecorp’s reserves.
> Assets added to the roadmap today: QCAD (QCAD)[https://t.co/rRB9d3hSr2](https://t.co/rRB9d3hSr2) > > — Coinbase Assets 🛡️📞 (@CoinbaseAssets) [April 29, 2024](https://twitter.com/CoinbaseAssets/status/1785001092301939089?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)
That’s a small amount relative to stablecoin giants like USDT and USDC, which have over $140 billion USD worth of tokens combined spread throughout the crypto ecosystem.
[![Image 5](https://cimg.co/p/assets/empty-cryptonews.jpg)](https://rapi.cryptonews.com/outgoing/908/1/5)
“Our goal is to list every asset possible that meets our standards for legal, compliance, and technical security,” Coinbase’s [blog post](https://www.coinbase.com/en-ca/blog/increasing-transparency-for-new-asset-listings-on-coinbase) on upcoming listings stated. “These standards do not take into account the market cap or popularity of a project.”
As such, onboarding Coinbase – the largest crypto exchange in the United States and the only publicly traded firm of its kind – could be a boon for adoption.
“With increased regulatory clarity from the Canadian Securities Administrators (CSA), the timing is perfect to bring Canadians a transparent, efficient stablecoin,” said Stablecorp CEO Alex McDougall last year.
Compliance With Canadian Regulators -----------------------------------
Shortly after the collapse of FTX and Terra in 2022, the [CSA issued guidance to crypto trading platforms](https://www.osc.ca/en/securities-law/instruments-rules-policies/2/21-333/csa-staff-notice-21-333-crypto-asset-trading-platforms-terms-and-conditions-trading-value), establishing a high bar for stablecoins or other pegged assets to receive listing. Stablecoins would require reserves of “highly liquid assets” with “qualified custodians,” and [algorithmic stablecoins](https://cryptonews.com/news/iron-finance-s-algorithmic-stablecoins-warning-hits-mark-cub-10728.htm) were completely ruled out.
The strict guidance contributed to Kraken and Coinbase delisting USDT and Wrapped Bitcoin (WBTC) from their platforms and to Binance moving out of the country entirely.
Coinbase, however, became the first international crypto exchange to [gain registration as a “restricted dealer”](https://www.coinbase.com/blog/coinbase-obtains-registration-as-a-restricted-dealer-in-canada) in Canada last month, signaling its sufficient compliance with regulators.
The company has often credited Canadian regulators with being cooperative with the crypto industry in ways that U.S. regulators are not. The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), for example, is currently [suing Coinbase, Kraken, and Binance](https://cryptonews.com/news/support-for-coinbase-industry-leaders-call-on-sec-to-draft-clear-crypto-regulations.htm) for securities law violations.
“We’ve collaborated with Canadian banks, investment advisors, and pension funds to demonstrate our dedication to facilitating their successful navigation of the evolving digital asset realm,” the company wrote last month.

Title: Stacks Price Prediction as STX Token Slides Under $2 – How Low Will STX Go?
URL Source: https://cryptonews.com/news/stacks-price-prediction-as-stx-token-slides-under-2-how-low-will-stx-go.htm
Published Time: 2024-05-02T00:03:26+00:00
Markdown Content: ![Image 1: Joel Frank](https://cimg.co/authors/884/responsive-images/310170788-443905671162233-4489539176282530633-n___media_library_original_300_300.jpg)
Last updated: May 2, 2024 at 00:03 UTC | 2 min read
[![Image 2: an orange button with a white text on it](https://cimg.co/other/523/335247/banner-eng.png)](https://rapi.cryptonews.com/outgoing/523/1/9)
[![Image 3: new presales 2014 with an orange arrow pointing to it](https://cimg.co/other/844/337087/eng-sub-m-1.png)](https://rapi.cryptonews.com/outgoing/844/1/17)
![Image 4: Stacks Price Prediction as STX Token Slides Under $2 – How Low Will STX Go?](https://cimg.co/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/19180640/1708365999-stacks.jpg)
Stacks Price Prediction as STX Token Slides Under $2 – How Low Will STX Go?
As Bitcoin (BTC) corrects to its lowest levels in over two months below $60,000, its largest layer-2 scaling blockchain Stacks (STX) is also in decline, with the Stacks price hitting its lowest levels since mid-February below $2.0.
The Stacks price has since bounced back to around $2.14, with STX now flat on the day.
But it might not be long until [STX](https://cryptonews.com/exclusives/what-is-stacks.htm) breaks more forcefully to the downside of $2.06 and the $2.0 level.
That’s because Stacks largely takes it cue from what [Bitcoin](https://cryptonews.com/news/bitcoin-news/) is doing, as well as how [altcoins](https://cryptonews.com/news/altcoin-news/) are performing.
And, as of now, pretty much the entire crypto space in a state of bearishness.
[Spot Bitcoin ETF flows](https://cryptonews.com/news/bitcoin-etfs-continue-to-see-net-outflows-as-btc-price-drops.htm) have been negative now for five days, as per data presented by The Block.
![Image 5: As per The Block, US ETFs have seen outflows now for five straight days.](https://cimg.co/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/01232829/1714606109-screenshot-2024-05-01-171258.png)
As per The Block, US ETFs have seen outflows now for five straight days.
That’s not surprising given [recent macro headwinds](https://cryptonews.com/news/bitcoin-traders-target-test-of-53000-support-as-btc-price-predictions-remains-bearish-following-fed-meeting.htm). While [today’s Fed policy announcement](https://www.reuters.com/markets/rates-bonds/fed-hold-rates-steady-inflation-dims-hopes-policy-easing-2024-05-01/) didn’t contain any surprises, it reinforced the message that rate cuts remain some way off.
[![Image 6](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)](https://rapi.cryptonews.com/outgoing/387/1/5)
The Fed has turned more hawkish recently due to inflation remaining uncomfortably high since the start of 2024.
It’s no surprise then that the [Bitcoin](https://cryptonews.com/coins/bitcoin/) price, as well as [altcoin](https://cryptonews.com/cryptocurrency/what-are-altcoins/) markets, have suffered a correction.
**Here’s Where the Stacks Price Is Headed Next** ------------------------------------------------
So, risks seem tilted to the downside for [Stacks (STX)](https://cryptonews.com/news/stacks-stx-value-drops-investors-move-towards-algotech-algt.htm). The next major support level, assuming the January highs at $2.06 goes, is the 200DMA.
The 200DMA currently resides just above $1.80. A break below here would send a significant bearish signal.
The next major area of support that traders would target would be around $1.25.
If Stacks was to fall 40% to here, its market cap would subside to under $2 billion.
This could be a great time to load up on STX, which remains a major leader in [Bitcoin layer-2 scaling](https://cryptonews.com/news/bitcoins-layer-2-ecosystem-is-booming-as-fourth-halving-approaches.htm).
![Image 7: The Stacks price could slump all the way as low as $1.25 support.](https://cimg.co/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/02000135/1714608095-screenshot-2024-05-01-185951.png)
The Stacks price could slump all the way as low as $1.25 support. Source: TradingView
Amid the bearish outlook for altcoins like Stacks, traders are hunting for alternatives that could deliver near-term upside.
Presale investing is an often-overlooked strategy that can deliver strong returns.
And one presale has caught the attention of analysts at Cryptonews – [Mega Dice](https://cryptonews.com/ext/dice/).

DICE holders get big cashback benefits on their wagers and can also generate passive income via DICE staking.

Title: Bitcoin's Historical Data Suggests A Potential 99% Surge, Says Crypto Analyst: 'Time To Buy The Dip!'
URL Source: https://www.benzinga.com/markets/cryptocurrency/24/05/38570836/bitcoins-historical-data-suggests-a-potential-99-surge-says-crypto-analyst-time-to-buy-the
Published Time: 2024-05-01T21:08:20.000-04:00
Markdown Content: As the cryptocurrency market continues to experience turbulence, **Bitcoin** BTC/USD might be on the brink of a significant upswing, according to historical data.
**What Happened**: **Ali Martinez**, a prominent crypto analyst, took to social media platform X to share a promising insight. Martinez highlighted the potential for a substantial Bitcoin surge, based on historical trends.
“The last three times the #Bitcoin 30-day MVRV dropped below -9% in the last two years, the price of $BTC surged by 64%, 63%, and 99%, respectively. The #BTC 30-day MVRV is currently at -11.6%, suggesting it may be time to buy the dip!” Martinez wrote.
The MVRV ratio, which divides an asset’s market capitalization by its realized capitalization, is a pivotal metric in the crypto space. A higher MVRV ratio typically indicates a greater potential profit, potentially leading to increased selling pressure.
_See Also: [How Did Shiba Inu Become The ‘Dogecoin Killer?’ Crypto Whale Thinks ‘Its Mission’ And This One Factor Were Key](https://www.benzinga.com/markets/cryptocurrency/24/05/38552945/how-did-shiba-inu-become-the-dogecoin-killer-crypto-whale-thinks-its-mission-and-this-one-?itm_source=parsely-api)_
**Why It Matters**: This insight comes at a time when the crypto market is facing significant challenges. On the same day, [Bitcoin’s value dropped below $58,000](https://www.benzinga.com/markets/cryptocurrency/24/05/38546976/bitcoin-plummets-below-58k-eth-sol-doge-follow-over-400m-liquidated-in-deepest-retrace-in-), triggering losses for other major cryptocurrencies like **Ethereum** ETH/USD, **Solana** SOL/USD, and **Dogecoin** DOGE/USD.
Moreover, [crypto research firm 10x Research](https://www.benzinga.com/markets/cryptocurrency/24/05/38560890/why-bitcoin-might-drop-another-20-10x-research) has predicted a further 20% drop in Bitcoin’s value, citing the differing risk management approaches between institutional investors and retail traders.
However, if Martinez’s analysis holds true, Bitcoin could be on the verge of a remarkable recovery. This is particularly noteworthy in light of [concerns raised by analysts](https://www.benzinga.com/markets/cryptocurrency/24/05/38562986/bitcoin-etf-retail-degens-could-start-selling-their-positions-at-58k-analyst-warns) about potential selling pressure from retail “degens” who bought Bitcoin ETFs at around $58,000.
**Price Action**: Bitcoin is currently priced at $57,635, marking a 1.08% decrease over the last 24 hours. However, it has seen an impressive 30.48% increase since the beginning of the year, according to the data [from Benzinga Pro](https://pro.benzinga.com/dashboard).
_Read Next: [Are Dogecoin And Shiba Inu Due A Bounce? This Trader Sees ‘Bull Flag’ Forming For One Coin](https://www.benzinga.com/markets/cryptocurrency/24/05/38564859/are-dogecoin-and-shiba-inu-due-a-bounce-this-trader-sees-bull-flag-forming-for-one-coin?itm_source=parsely-api)_

item.description:
Title: MicroStrategy to launch Bitcoin-based decentralized ID solution
URL Source: https://cointelegraph.com/news/microstrategy-bitcoin-decentralized-identity-solution
Published Time: 2024-05-02T02:30:50.000Z
Markdown Content: MicroStrategy has already built an application on “MicroStrategy Orange” — Orange For Outlook — which integrates digital signatures into emails to verify the identity of the sender.
441 Total views
6 Total shares
![Image 1: MicroStrategy to launch Bitcoin-based decentralized ID solution](https://images.cointelegraph.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=90,width=1434/https://s3.cointelegraph.com/uploads/2024-05/fde3f455-d44d-4d80-ac8a-42264ed6c90b.jpg)
Own this piece of crypto history
[Collect this article as NFT](https://mint.cointelegraph.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcointelegraph.com%2Fnews%2Fmicrostrategy-bitcoin-decentralized-identity-solution&utm_source=cointelegraph_com&utm_medium=button&utm_campaign=articles)
MicroStrategy, the largest corporate holder of Bitcoin ([BTC](https://cointelegraph.com/bitcoin-price)), has announced it will launch a decentralized identity solution on the Bitcoin network that uses Ordinal-based inscriptions to store and retrieve information.
The solution, MicroStrategy Orange, was unveiled by executive chairman Michael Saylor [during](https://www.microstrategy.com/video/bitcoin-for-corporations-2024) the company’s Bitcoin For Corporations conference on May 1.
MicroStrategy Orange is open-source, not dependent on sidechains and can process up to 10,000 decentralized identifiers in a single Bitcoin transaction, Saylor claimed.
“\[Its aim is to\] deliver trustless, tamper-proof, and long-lived decentralized identities using only the public Bitcoin blockchain as a data source,” [according](https://microstrategy.github.io/did-btc-spec/) to an unofficial draft document of the solution shared by MicroStrategy on GitHub.
The decentralized identifiers (DIDs) will allow pseudonymity in the same way that real-world identities are not tied to Bitcoin addresses and transactions.
![Image 2](https://s3.cointelegraph.com/uploads/2024-05/f9e361a9-28ae-4bed-b218-afa0b30c7fc3.png)
_Michael Saylor speaking at the Bitcoin For Corporations conference. Source: YouTube_
MicroStrategy Orange comprises Orange Service, Orange SDK and Orange Applications.
Orange Service allows users to issue DIDs to their personnel and deploy applications, while Orange SDK and Orange Applications provide them with customization tools to integrate specific services on mobile and desktop devices.
One such application already built by MicroStrategy is “Orange For Outlook” — which integrates digital signatures into emails to ensure recipients can verify the true identity of the sender.
The onboarding process involves accepting an invitation email signed by MicroStrategy’s DID, which will then generate a unique DID, a public and private key pair for the user.
[The user’s DID and public key](https://cointelegraph.com/news/how-decentralized-identities-are-reshaping-our-communities-and-digital-identities-interview-with-did) are inscribed on the Bitcoin network, who can then start sending out invitations to their personnel to create their own digital identity.
![Image 3: sign and verify workflow](https://s3.cointelegraph.com/uploads/2024-05/6c2794b5-574e-4e19-94a7-260658e756ab.png)
_Flow diagram of how MicroStrategy’s Orange For Outlook application works. Source: MicroStrategy_
The firm wants MicroStrategy Orange applications to extend to other messaging platforms, social media networks and applications in the e-commerce, enterprise and fintech industries.
**_Related:_** [**_MicroStrategy listing in the S&P 500 index could expose millions to Bitcoin_**](https://cointelegraph.com/news/microstrategy-listing-sp-500-index-exposes-millions-bitcoin)
It comes as MicroStrategy reported a [$53.1 million net loss](https://cointelegraph.com/news/microstrategy-records-q1-net-loss-bitcoin-buying-spree-continues) for the first quarter on April 30.
However, the reporting under the traditional accounting method didn’t factor in the 65% increase inthe market value of MicroStrategy’s 214,400 Bitcoin — worth $15.2 billion at the time — over the quarter.
**_Magazine:_** [**_Should you ‘orange pill’ children? The case for Bitcoin kids books_**](https://cointelegraph.com/magazine/orange-pill-children-bitcoin-kids-books/)
Explore more articles like this
Subscribe to our Crypto Biz newsletter

Title: BlackRock’s Bitcoin ETF sees first outflow day as US ETFs notch record bleed
URL Source: https://cointelegraph.com/news/blackrock-bitcoin-etf-first-outflow-day-etfs-record-outflows
Published Time: 2024-05-02T03:06:34.000Z
Markdown Content: BlackRock’s IBIT saw around $37 million in outflows for the first time while the remaining spot Bitcoin ETFs collectively notched over $526.8 million in outflows.
273 Total views
1 Total shares
![Image 1: BlackRock’s Bitcoin ETF sees first outflow day as US ETFs notch record bleed](https://images.cointelegraph.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=90,width=1434/https://s3.cointelegraph.com/uploads/2024-05/d6b5f6c6-ab8a-4b33-ae5d-3b488162f467.jpg)
Own this piece of crypto history
[Collect this article as NFT](https://mint.cointelegraph.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcointelegraph.com%2Fnews%2Fblackrock-bitcoin-etf-first-outflow-day-etfs-record-outflows&utm_source=cointelegraph_com&utm_medium=button&utm_campaign=articles)
The United States’ spot Bitcoin ([BTC](https://cointelegraph.com/bitcoin-price)) exchange-traded funds (ETF) have posted record net outflows with BlackRock’s iShares Bitcoin Trust (IBIT) also seeing its first-ever outflow day.
BlackRock’s Bitcoin fund saw $36.6 million flow out on May 1, [according](https://twitter.com/HODL15Capital/status/1785841649265844411) to HODL15 Capital.
Nine other Bitcoin ETFs saw a combined $526.8 million in outflows — the Hashdex Bitcoin ETF (DEFI) was the only one with zero flows, [per](https://farside.co.uk/?p=1321) preliminary Farside Investors data.
The largest outflow for the day was the Fidelity Wise Origin Bitcoin Fund (FBTC), which saw $191.1million in net outflows.
The Grayscale Bitcoin Trust (GBTC) was second with an outflow of $167.4 million.
It is the largest single outflow day for the U.S. spot Bitcoin ETFs, which saw the ARK 21Shares Bitcoin ETF and Franklin Bitcoin ETF at $98.1 million and $13.4 million in outflows, respectively.
It comes as Bitcoin has fallen 10.7% over the last week.
**_Related:_** [**_Australia’s top exchange may approve spot Bitcoin ETFs this year: Report_**](https://cointelegraph.com/news/australian-stock-exchange-asx-approve-spot-bitcoin-etf)
However, ETF Store president Nate Geraci pointed out that the iShares Gold ETF and SPDR Gold ETFs have had $1 billion and $3 billion in outflows so far this year.
Yet, gold is up 16% year-to-date, Geraci [noted](https://x.com/NateGeraci/status/1785849570552852579) in a May 2 X post.
![Image 2](https://s3.cointelegraph.com/uploads/2024-05/dfd7cb00-52ea-44c8-abd1-7470a78f7ba0.png)
_Source:_ [_Nate Geraci_](https://x.com/NateGeraci/status/1785849570552852579)
Bloomberg ETF analyst James Seyffart [noted](https://x.com/JSeyff/status/1785843582420541666) that the Bitcoin ETFs are still “operating smoothly across the board” and that “inflows and outflows are part of the norm in the life of an ETF.”

item.title: News Article 52
item.description:
Title: Bitcoin Hits ‘Danger Zone’: Peter Schiff Warns Of ‘Do or Die’ Scenario
URL Source: https://www.newsbtc.com/bitcoin-news/bitcoin-hits-danger-zone-peter-schiff-warns-of-do-or-die-scenario/
Published Time: 2024-05-02T03:00:43Z
Markdown Content: Bitcoin is facing a critical juncture as it has entered a ‘danger zone,’ according to prominent gold advocate Peter Schiff. This investor, known for his skepticism toward Bitcoin, [suggests](https://x.com/PeterSchiff/status/1785420040281436398) that the cryptocurrency is entering a “do or die” phase, potentially marking the end of its bullish run if [current trends continue](https://www.newsbtc.com/bitcoin-news/bitcoin-greed-sentiment-neutral-57000-plunge/).
Breaking Points And Bearish Signals -----------------------------------
Peter Schiff has often voiced his bearish outlook on Bitcoin, and his latest comments come as Bitcoin has just slipped below the crucial $60,000 mark.
This level had previously served as strong support during the short-term bull run, and its breach has intensified the bearish sentiment among investors. Schiff warns that staying below this threshold could spell doom for the bullish fervor, potentially derailing [Bitcoin’s momentum](https://www.newsbtc.com/news/bitcoin/bitcoin-milestone-ahead-analyst-forecasts-new-peak-this-month/).
![Image 1](https://servedbyadbutler.com/error/blank.gif)
[![Image 2: bbc iPlayer - screenshot](https://servedbyadbutler.com/getad.img/;libID=4141110)](https://servedbyadbutler.com/redirect.spark?MID=172179&plid=2392605&setID=366606&channelID=0&CID=878423&banID=521869883&PID=0&textadID=0&tc=1&scheduleID=2311165&adSize=728x90&mt=1714620851125485&sw=800&sh=600&spr=1&referrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.newsbtc.com%2Fbitcoin-news%2Fbitcoin-hits-danger-zone-peter-schiff-warns-of-do-or-die-scenario%2F&hc=07bd73f0c7783a9fb3d703a41a08a257420c243b&location=)
At the time of writing, Bitcoin is trading at approximately $57,054, teetering close to its 100-day Exponential Moving Average (EMA). Schiff points out that remaining below this EMA could confirm a bearish trend, signaling an end to the rally.
Amidst these developments, the market has seen an increase in trading volume, coupled with the price drop, indicating strong selling pressure.
Over the last 24 hours, Bitcoin’s trading volume has dropped from $45 billion to $48 billion, coinciding with a 6.3% price dip during the same period. This heightened activity is a [traditional bearish](https://www.newsbtc.com/news/bitcoin/if-history-rhymes-bitcoin-price-next-6-months/) indicator, lending weight to Schiff’s [prediction of a downturn](https://www.newsbtc.com/news/bitcoin/bitcoin-price-dips-below-57000-4-key-reasons/).
[![Image 3: a gold and black poker chip with the words huge get bonus](https://servedbyadbutler.com/getad.img/;libID=4118444)](https://servedbyadbutler.com/redirect.spark?MID=172179&plid=2374569&setID=452518&channelID=0&CID=873125&banID=521839794&PID=0&textadID=0&tc=1&scheduleID=2293218&adSize=728x90&mt=1714620851218877&sw=800&sh=600&spr=1&referrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.newsbtc.com%2Fbitcoin-news%2Fbitcoin-hits-danger-zone-peter-schiff-warns-of-do-or-die-scenario%2F&hc=02aaa7966c014d9ca5ad41696aed4d5334f7155b&location=)
Moreover, investor sentiment is treading thin ice with significant outflows from Bitcoin spot ETFs, hitting a weekly high of $162 million. This departure of funds is particularly poignant as it unfolds just before the FOMC meeting, where potential interest rate hikes are on the agenda.
These outflows reflect a broader market trend, with the Grayscale Bitcoin Trust (GBTC) experiencing a substantial daily outflow of $93.23 million.
> According to SoSoValue, total net outflows from Bitcoin spot ETFs yesterday, April 30, were as high as $162 million. GrayscaleETF GBTC had a single-day net outflow of US$93.2277 million, and the current historical net outflow of GBTC is US$17.303 billion. The total net asset… [pic.twitter.com/jSCtfVrW8l](https://t.co/jSCtfVrW8l) > > — Wu Blockchain (@WuBlockchain) [May 1, 2024](https://twitter.com/WuBlockchain/status/1785521279447257516?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)
The Bitcoin ETF Conundrum And Market Forecasts ----------------------------------------------
It is worth noting that last month was quite challenging for US Bitcoin ETFs. After a promising start with positive inflows in the initial months following their launch, April witnessed collective outflows amounting to $182 million across all active spot Bitcoin ETFs in the US.
[![Image 4: a screen shot of a purple and blue background](https://servedbyadbutler.com/getad.img/;libID=4112492)](https://servedbyadbutler.com/redirect.spark?MID=172179&plid=2368657&setID=452519&channelID=0&CID=697925&banID=521829427&PID=0&textadID=0&tc=1&scheduleID=2287439&adSize=728x90&mt=1714620851323146&sw=800&sh=600&spr=1&referrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.newsbtc.com%2Fbitcoin-news%2Fbitcoin-hits-danger-zone-peter-schiff-warns-of-do-or-die-scenario%2F&hc=95ffef94b0871c48f4c4f8c37708f2f18bdd58e8&location=)
This pullback is attributed to macroeconomic concerns and geopolitical tensions, which have clouded the investment landscape.
![Image 5: Bitcoin (BTC) price chart on TradingView](https://www.tradingview.com/x/EM08N5GW/)
BTC price is moving sideways on the 1-hour chart. Source: BTC/USDT on [TradingView.com](https://www.tradingview.com/chart/HSuSIPeM/?symbol=BINANCE%3ABTCUSDT)
As the market braces for further turbulence, analysts such as Micheal Van de Poppe are [forecasting](https://twitter.com/CryptoMichNL/status/1785364388330824109?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw) an additional correction, potentially pushing Bitcoin’s price [down to $55,000](https://www.newsbtc.com/analysis/btc/bitcoin-price-nosedives-60k/) before any sign of recovery.
> Monthly close approaching for [#Bitcoin](https://twitter.com/hashtag/Bitcoin?src=hash&ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw) and FOMC day tomorrow. > > I think we’ll see that sweep beneath $60K and potentially cascade towards $55-58K from which we’re finding the low and rotate back upwards. > > From there: Ethereum ETF hype in May to pick up momentum. [pic.twitter.com/Iki4De9mSF](https://t.co/Iki4De9mSF) > > — Michaël van de Poppe (@CryptoMichNL) [April 30, 2024](https://twitter.com/CryptoMichNL/status/1785364388330824109?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)
Featured image from Unsplash, Chart from TradingView

You are advised to conduct your own research before making any investment decisions. Use information provided on this website entirely at your own risk.

item.description:
Title: Senator Lummis Challenges US Crackdown On Crypto Market, Vows To Protect Investor’s Rights | Bitcoinist.com
URL Source: https://bitcoinist.com/sen-lummis-challenges-us-crackdown-on-crypto-market/
Published Time: 2024-05-01T22:00:13-05:00
Markdown Content: In the face of growing global regulatory pressure on the crypto industry, the Biden administration’s intensified crackdown and the actions of regulatory bodies have prompted Senator Cynthia Lummis to issue a strong statement against the US government’s stance on the industry.
Senator Lummis, a prominent supporter of Bitcoin and the overall crypto market, has advocated for the companies and players involved in the ongoing regulatory pressure.
[![Image 1: a banner with the words'bitstarz' and an image of a woman in a red dress](https://servedbyadbutler.com/getad.img/;libID=844202)](https://servedbyadbutler.com/redirect.spark?MID=172179&plid=1983102&setID=367529&channelID=0&CID=727083&banID=520891527&PID=0&textadID=0&tc=1&scheduleID=1911064&adSize=728x90&mt=1714620874947424&sw=800&sh=600&spr=1&referrer=https%3A%2F%2Fbitcoinist.com%2Fsen-lummis-challenges-us-crackdown-on-crypto-market%2F&hc=ecfc987143285f494922f505f08ef3f053bb6d2b&location=)
Lummis Condemns DOJ’s “Hyper-Aggressive” Stance -----------------------------------------------
Lummis expressed deep concern and [opposed](https://x.com/SenLummis/status/1785695683514630367) the Department of Justice’s (DOJ) “hyper-aggressive” argument that non-custodial software could be classified as a money transmission service.
The Senator deemed this stance contradictory to existing Treasury guidance, lacking common sense, and violating the rule of law.
Lummis further emphasized that arguments against self-custody software pose a threat to fundamental property rights that are intrinsic to being an American.
[![Image 2: bbc iPlayer - screenshot](https://servedbyadbutler.com/getad.img/;libID=4141110)](https://servedbyadbutler.com/redirect.spark?MID=172179&plid=2392606&setID=476001&channelID=0&CID=878423&banID=521869883&PID=0&textadID=0&tc=1&scheduleID=2311166&adSize=728x90&mt=1714620874948955&sw=800&sh=600&spr=1&referrer=https%3A%2F%2Fbitcoinist.com%2Fsen-lummis-challenges-us-crackdown-on-crypto-market%2F&hc=38222fa9c269d04e4814ee811bf2df3a8df48d11&location=)
Lummis asserted her commitment to fighting for individuals’ rights to hold their keys and operate their nodes, expressing her dismay at the Biden administration’s criminalization of the core tenets of the Bitcoin (BTC) network and [decentralized finance](https://bitcoinist.com/bitcoin-will-go-up-senator-lummis/) (DeFi).
Senator Lummis had previously [disapproved](https://bitcoinist.com/senator-lummis-criticizes-secs-crypto-crackdown/) [](https://bitcoinist.com/senator-lummis-criticizes-secs-crypto-crackdown/)of the Securities and Exchange Commission’s (SEC) escalated crackdown on the crypto industry throughout 2023. [![Image 3: a screen shot of a purple and blue background](https://servedbyadbutler.com/getad.img/;libID=4112488)](https://servedbyadbutler.com/redirect.spark?MID=172179&plid=2368622&setID=476002&channelID=0&CID=697928&banID=521829420&PID=0&textadID=0&tc=1&scheduleID=2287404&adSize=728x90&mt=1714620875108087&sw=800&sh=600&spr=1&referrer=https%3A%2F%2Fbitcoinist.com%2Fsen-lummis-challenges-us-crackdown-on-crypto-market%2F&hc=a3895f353f4935f5b099b926be8b8da8775879bf&location=)
Criticizing the SEC’s actions as “unnecessary” and “overreaching,” she specifically opposed the agency’s controversial new crypto policy, known as “Staff Accounting Bulletin 121,” issued in March 2022.
Lummis had also filed an [amicus brief](https://bitcoinist.com/cynthia-lummis-backs-coinbase/) in support of the Coinbase exchange against the SEC’s lawsuit, arguing that Congress should be responsible for formulating crypto regulations rather than the SEC.
The pro-crypto Senator contended that the SEC had exceeded its mandate by attempting to classify almost all crypto assets as “securities,” thus infringing on Congress’s legislative authority and extending beyond the agency’s jurisdiction.
Clear Guidelines For Crypto Regulation --------------------------------------
In another statement supporting key players in the crypto market, Senator Lummis called for immediate action to establish clear [regulatory guidelines](https://bitcoinist.com/xrp-lummis-calls-for-crypto-transparency/) in response to Judge Analisa Torres’ ruling that XRP should not be considered a security.
At the core of the debate is the Howey Test, a legal standard used to determine whether an investment qualifies as a security. Lummis has emphasized the importance of preserving the integrity of this test while acknowledging the need to apply it appropriately to digital assets.
To address these issues, Senator Lummis, in collaboration with Senator Kirsten Gillibrand, has introduced the Lummis-Gillibrand bill. The legislation aims to provide regulatory clarity for [digital assets](https://bitcoinist.com/bitcoin-can-be-the-standard-lummis/) like XRP, aligning their treatment with the interpretation of the Howey Test as established by the Southern District of New York.
![Image 4: Crypto](https://www.tradingview.com/x/hCXnA07h/)
The daily chart shows that BTC’s price is trending downward. Source: [BTCUSD on TradingView.com](https://www.tradingview.com/chart/7W2R5XTA/)
The largest cryptocurrency on the market, Bitcoin, is trading at $57,800 after hitting a low of $56,400 in the early hours of Wednesday.
Featured image from Yahoo, chart from TradingView.com
